com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface confirmDraftOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface confirmDraftOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document confirmDraftOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The confirmDraftOrder API confirms completion of a draft order, and moves it to a Status of Created or Reserved.

    • Method Detail

      • confirmDraftOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document confirmDraftOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                       org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                       java.rmi.RemoteException
        The confirmDraftOrder API confirms completion of a draft order, and moves it to a Status of Created or Reserved. A draft order has a Status of DraftOrderCreated when the order is not reserved or DraftOrderReserved when the order has been reserved. The DraftOrderFlag is set to Y for such an order. Confirming a draft creates an actual order, with a Status of Created, or Reserved and the DraftOrderFlag is set to N.

        When confirmDraftOrder is called, all related database updates, such as inventory updates, are also performed. However, for a ReservedDraftOrder, inventory updates are already performed.
        If during order confirmation, order line is a PROD item and delivery method specified is Cash And Carry, the Shipped Quantity will be updated on the order line.

        If the draft order has valid payment information, the payment status is updated to AWAIT_AUTH.
        Otherwise, the payment status is updated to AWAIT_PAY_INFO.

        To remove order lines from a draft order, use the changeOrder API.

        If during order confirmation, order line reservations exists, system will atempt to match order line to order line reservations. If they match, line will consume order line reservations. Please see createOrder API for the matching logic.

        This is a hold type enabled transaction. If order has a hold type which has DRAFT_ORDER_CONFIRM as one of the prevented transactions then order can not be confirmed. Error OMP11037: Transaction is prevented when order is on hold type is thrown.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSVerifyOrderConfirmationUE

        Events Raised:
        ON_SUCCESS

          Data published - YFS_DRAFT_ORDER_CONFIRM.ON_SUCCESS.xml
          Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

          Template Support:
          Yes. Some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to xml for element level details.

        INCOMPLETE_PAYMENT_INFORMATION
          Data published - YFS_confirmDraftOrder_output.xml
          Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

          Template Support:
          Yes. Some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to xml for element level details.

        ON_HOLD_TYPE_STATUS_CHANGE:
          This event is raised for each hold type of which status has been changed. Data published - YFS_ON_HOLD_TYPE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
          Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

        Template Support:
        Yes.
        ON_ORDER_LINE_HOLD_TYPE_STATUS_CHANGE:
          This event is raised for each hold type of which status has been changed. Data published - YFS_ON_ORDER_LINE_HOLD_TYPE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
          Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

        Template Support:
        Yes.
        ON_AWAITING_RESERVATION_ACCEPTANCE:
          This event is raised for each status on order. Data published - YFS_DRAFT_ORDER_CONFIRM.ON_AWAITING_RESERVATION_ACCEPTANCE.xml
          Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

        Template Support:
        Yes.

      ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE:
        This event is raised when an order release status is changed for the order. Data published -YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
        Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt

      Template Support:
      Yes.

    Audits: None

    Pre-conditions:

    • The draft order must already exist.
    • The draft order must have at least one order line.
    • The draft order must have valid BillTo information.
    • ALL lines of the draft order must be ready to be picked up by this transaction.

    Error if draft order cannot be confirmed:YFS10422 - YFS_CANNOT_CONFIRM_ORDER

    Post-conditions: No

    Output Template Support:
    Yes. Some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to output xml for element level details.

    Database Extensibility Support: Yes


    Additional Information:

Hold Type Processing

    An order may be associated with one or more hold types upon order confirmation. Hold types can be configured to be applied during order confirmation. For each hold type on an order, a task queue request is created for the processing transaction of that hold type. The task queue will be updated so that, if applicable, the transactions prevented for the order on that hold type will not pick up that order.

Payment Processing


    When a draft order is confirmed, payment processing begins as though it were a newly created order. See createOrder for more details.


Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document that contains details of the newly confirmed Order. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException
